Entries.default: "That was a disaster of epic proportions if ever I directed one." Arms flailing wildly before her, the stage performer shoos the other actors from the set.
"Everything's coming along beautifully on our end. I got a new script, I'm drafting up!"
"They love us! Do you see? They gods damned love us, thanks to you!"
"Another empty audience?"
"Ondra's gills! There's no hope!"
"A typhoon couldn't have cleared out our audience faster!"
"Who are you guys?"
"What's wrong?"
"Oh, of course you haven't heard of us! Like I needed more proof that we're talentless hacks." Her shoulders slump, but then she seems to regain herself, chin up as she answers you.

"My troupe's coming apart at the seams! We're short on cash. We're low on people. And we've run plumb dry on enthusiasm."

She ticks the points on her fingers.
"We haven't drawn a decent crowd in more than a fortnight. And it ain't like pirates are hard to please. "That's how you know the show really stinks."

"But I think I know what the problem is. We've got a lack of flair. 

"If only I could hire more talented performers, I just know my play would take off."
"I'll help you."
"What's your play about?"
"What would you need to improve the play?"
"Good luck with that."
"Really? That's great! Then we could - " Abruptly, her eyes narrow, her dark brows furrowing with heavy suspicion.
"I'm in desperate need of two more performers - a wizard for one, plus any oaf big enough to pose as Eothas."

"I happen to know a wizard of the finest skillset who already performs here in Dunnage - Taerna, at the King's Coffin.

"But unfortunately, I got no idea of where we might find a suitable Eothas."

"Get me the right people for the parts, and I promise you'll be pleased with your investment.

"I'll turn us a profit or die trying."
"Only the biggest thing to hit the Deadfire since the Vailian Trading Company started hunting us like sea-hounds."
"A better Eothas, for one. I'm the tallest one in our troupe, but I'm still not very convincing even when I bother to dye my skin blue."
"What's your play about?"
"What would you need to improve the play?"

"Stick around for the performance. I think you'll be plenty pleased." She spreads her hands as if about to take a bow. But instead she snaps her fingers together and the stage darkens behind her, signaling the start of the show.
"Farewell."
"Only the biggest thing to hit the Deadfire since the Vailian Trading Company started hunting us like sea-hounds."
"A better Eothas, for one. I'm the tallest one in our troupe, but I'm still not very convincing even when I bother to dye my skin blue."
"I'm in desperate need of two more performers - a wizard for one, plus any oaf big enough to pose as Eothas."

"I happen to know a wizard of the finest skillset who already performs here in Dunnage - Taerna, at the King's Coffin.

"But unfortunately, I got no idea of where we might find a suitable Eothas."
"Also, our special stage effects aren't all that special anymore. We had someone for that role, but she got herself into debt and has a new job at the King's Coffin."
"Just helping out a fellow patron of the arts."
"I don't see anyone else helping you, do you?"
"I expect a cut of the profits, of course."
"I'd really like to see how the play turns out."
"Ah, of course. Well, that's more than fair."
"Right. Beggars can't be choosers, I suppose." She strokes one of her bushy eyebrows thoughtfully.
"How fortuitous." She sucks in a surprised breath.
"With you helping me acquire the right talent, I'd wager it's going to be phenomenal."
"Thanks muchly for bringing Taerna back to us. Her storm and weather spells will really strike an atmosphere for the play."
"Where'd you find a blue-green aumaua? And a damned giant of one, too! All right, maybe he can't see so well, but I can work with that. He's perfect."
"I still need someone to replace me as Eothas, though."
"And now that we've got a real big brute for Eothas, we can put on a proper play."
"I still need Taerna to cast the spells for our stage effects, though."
"And with Taerna back, we can finally put on a proper play."
"Wait a tick. Why would you help me? What do you get out of this?"
"What's wrong?! I'll tell you what - everything!"
"It's a damn fine chance to meet a fellow artist, especially in a port like Dunnage. We're a rare sort of bird, we are."
"I'm talking about Eothas storming through the archipelago and capsizing nearly a whole a fleet of our ships!"
"We're the Pegleg Performers. Formerly the Seabird Serenaders, formerly the Jaxe-Finingen First Ensemble of Dunnage."
"But now, well..." She tunnels her fingers through her hair. Sighs.
"Thanks again for your help. We couldn't have done it without you."
